---
title: Nothing-but-ism
tags:
 - concept
---

[Sellars](/docs/phil/people/Wilfrid Sellars.html)' term for the consequence of [descriptivism](/docs/phil/Descriptivism.html) (the tendency to assimlate all discourse to describing).

Examples:
- [Emotivism](/docs/phil/Emotivism.html)
	- claims about what you ought to do are not saying anything about how the world is
- [Behaviorism](/docs/phil/Behaviorism.html)
	- what we should be doing is describing the behavior, not looking upstream towards the internal representations 
- [Phenomenalism](/docs/phil/quotes/Against phenomenalism.html)
	-  physical objects are nothing but logical constructions out of sensory experiences
